description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 18 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses one of the following breath weapons.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} breathes &Reference[acid]{acid} in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide &Reference[line]{line}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save con 20 format=long]], taking [[/damage 13d8 type=acid average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales paralyzing gas in a 60-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save con 20 format=long]] or be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} magically polymorphs into a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} or &Reference[beast]{beast} that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and &Reference[int]{Intelligence}, &Reference[wis]{Wisdom}, and &Reference[cha]{Charisma} scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

  • The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} creates fog as if it had cast the fog cloud spell. The fog lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round.
  • A blisteringly &Reference[cold]{cold} wind blows through the lair near the &Reference[dragon]{dragon}. Each creature within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or take [[/damage 1d10 type=cold average=true]] damage. Gases and vapors are dispersed by the wind, and unprotected flames are extinguished. Protected flames, such as lanterns, have a 50 percent chance of being extinguished.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Regional Effects

The region containing a legendary Steel dragon’s lair is warped by the dragon’s magic, which creates one or more of the following effects.

  • Once per day, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can alter the weather in a 6-mile radius centered on its lair. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} doesn’t need to be outdoors; otherwise the effect is identical to the control weather spell.
  • Within 1 mile of the lair, winds buoy non-evil creatures that fall due to no act of the dragon’s or its allies. Such creatures descend at a rate of 60 feet per round and take no falling damage.
  • Given days or longer to work, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can make clouds and fog within its lair as solid as stone, forming structures and other objects as it wishes.

If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies, changed weather reverts to normal, as described in the spell, and the other effects fade in 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Detect. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

Tail Attack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 8 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
